definition.value: A reaction mixture role is a role of a chemical mixture undergoing some chemical reaction. [Allotrope]
A PCR role is a role of a material used in a PCR experiment. [Allotrope]

Reporter dye role is the role of a dye in a PCR experiment that binds to target DNA molecules and is detected via fluorescence when it is cleaved free. The fluorescence signal is proportional to DNA concentration. [Allotrope]
Passive reference dye role of a dye in a PCR experiment to provide a baseline for normalization of the fluorescence signal. [Allotrope]
Quencher dye role is the role of a dye in a PCR experiment that acts to suppress the fluorescence of a reporter dye in proximity. [Allotrope]
Relative standard deviation role is a statistical datum role of a datum that is a standardized measure of dispersion of a probability distribution or frequency distribution. [Wikipedia]
A purge gas role is a cleaning agent role of a gas used to remove or replace an existing gas. [Allotrope]
A product role (economic) is a general role of some continuant that is produced for the purpose of sale. [Allotrope]
An information product role is a contextual role of some information content entity that is produced for the purpose of sale. [Allotrope]
A physical product role is a role of some artifact that is produced for the purpose of sale. [Allotrope]
The z-coordinate role is the Cartesian coordinate in the third dimension of a 3-dimensional Cartesian coordinate system. [Allotrope]
The matrix are the components of a sample other than the analyte. [IUPAC]
A sample introduction medium is the role of a material that carries the sample in a sample introduction process. [Allotrope]
A loading role is a role that is realized in some loading process. [Allotrope]
A loading medium role is the role of the material that carries the loaded material. in a loading process. [Allotrope]
A localization role is a role that is realized in some localization process. [Allotrope]
A carrier role is the role of a material entity that supports another material or information localization process by keeping it moving or holding it at place. [Allotrope]
A carrying role is a role of an entity that is realized in a carrying process. [Allotrope]
The loaded material is the role of the material that is loaded into the destination. [Allotrope]
An abrading material role is an abrading role of a material whose surface is being applied to another material to cause abrasion. [Allotrope]
An abraded material is an abrading role of a material whose surface is being abraded in an abrading process. [Allotrope]
An abrading role is a role of an entity that is realized in an abrading process. [Allotrope]
An abrading source role is an abrading role of a device or human that abrades material using abrading material. [Allotrope]
A fraction role is the role of a member of the collection of material that is collected in a fraction collection process. [Allotrope]
The maximum value is a statistical datum role of a datum that is the largest value of a collection of numbers. [Wikipedia]
The minimum value is a statistical datum role of a datum that is the smallest value of a collection of numbers. [Wikipedia]
A role played by a participant in a dispensing process. [Allotrope]
Dispensed material is the role of material given out in a dispensing process. [Allotrope]
An internal standard sample role is a standard sample role of a material sample that contains a known amount of internal standard material. [Allotrope]
A matrix sample role is a sample role of a material sample that contains only material with the matrix role in some analysis. [Allotrope]

A narrow standard role is a standard sample role used in size-exclusion chromatography that has a narrow molecular-weight distribution and are typically chemically different than the sample. [Allotrope]

A broad standard role is a standard sample role used in size-exclusion chromatography that has a broad molecular-weight distribution and are usually the same polymer as the sample being analyzed. [Allotrope]
A fluorescent tag role is the role of a molecular entity in a fluorescence experiment that is attached chemically to aid in the detection of a biomolecule. [Allotrope, Wikipedia]
A fluorimetry role is a role of a material entity realized in a fluorimetry process. [Allotrope]
An initial value role is a statistical datum role of a datum that has no predecessor in an ordered collection. [Allotrope]
A final value role is a statistical datum role of a datum that has no successor  in an ordered collection. [Allotrope]
A positive control sample role is a control sample role of a material intended to produce a positive result under the correct experimental conditions. [Allotrope]
A negative control sample role is a control sample role of a material intended to produce a negative result under the correct experimental conditions. [Allotrope]
A heterozygous control sample role is a sample role of a material that is known to be heterozygous for an allele. [Allotrope]
A homozygous control sample role is a sample role of a material that is known to be homozygous for an allele. [Allotrope]
A reference DNA control sample role is a sample role of a material that contains a known reference DNA sequence. [Allotrope]

label.value: non-specific DNA amplification control sample role

definition.value: A non-specific DNA amplification control sample role is a control sample role for discerning the presence of non-specific DNA amplification. [Allotrope]
A site (organization) is a site where organizational entities are located such as an office or premise. [Allotrope]
A bench (site) is site in a workspace or laboratory where work is being done. [Allotrope]
A building (site) is a site located in a structure with a roof and walls. [Allotrope]
A room is a site that is a part or division of a building enclosed by walls, floor, and ceiling. [Allotrope]
A space is a site that can be occupied or where something can be done. [Allotrope]
A campus is a site that is the grounds of a school, hospital, or other institution. [Allotrope]
A section is a site that is a more or less distinct part of a site into which the site is divided. [Allotrope]
A well is a site that is a cavity in a surface open at the top. [Allotrope]
